awd_titl_txt: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectrometer for Undergraduate   Chemistry Instruction
awd_abstract_narration: This project will incorporate a 60-MHz nuclear magnetic resonance               spectrometer into upgraded undergraduate chemistry instruction at the           College of the Virgin Islands.  No other NMR is available in the region,        and geographic isolation precludes instrument-sharing with universities         or research centers on the mainland.  Availability of the NMR will              enhance the educational experience of students in organic, analytical,          inorganic, and physical chemistry laboratory courses.  In addition, the         instrument will be used by undergraduate students for research projects.        NMR spectrometry experiments to be integrated into the chemistry                curriculum are based on experiments published recently in the chemical          literature.  Providing hands-on experience with NMR spectrometry will           make a significant contribution to the chemistry education of                   undergraduate students at this historically Black college.
